title: Contracting & remodeling specializing in kitchens, West Michigan
business_description:
Here's a concise description of the business opportunity: 

Exciting opportunity to acquire a established contracting and remodeling company specializing in kitchens and bathrooms, complete with a unique design center. The company has successfully served West Michigan for over two decades and is currently generating consistent revenue. As the owners are looking forward to retirement, this is a chance to take over a well-established business with a strong reputation.

The business boasts a track record of successful projects and satisfied customers, paired with a trustworthy business model that is proven to generate revenue. With a focus on high-demand areas like kitchens and bathrooms, the company has a competitive edge in the market. Additionally, the presence of a specialized design center adds an extra touch of uniqueness to the company's offerings.

For anyone looking to step into a profitable business with a solid foundation, this opportunity provides a turnkey solution with experienced staff and existing clientele. The endorsement of trusted organizations like the Better Business Bureau further adds to the credibility of this business venture.
details: Sign Up

We are pleased to offer an exceptional business opportunity: A contracting & remodeling company with a primary focus on kitchen and bathrooms, featuring a specialty design center. After serving West Michigan for over 20 years the owners of this cash flowing company look forward to retirement after a meaningful post-close transition period for a new owner-operator.The construction arm of this attractive opportunity has enjoyed a steady increase in revenues year over year by focusing on exceptional craftsmanship. The bread and butter of this longstanding company is the remodeling of kitchens and bathrooms. The owner-operator is complimented by two skilled tradesmen and several long-time loyal sub-contractors. The owner looks forward to offering his skills and tutelage to the buyer through a meaningful transition period post-close.An incredible complement to this opportunity is the design center component. While a newer addition to the business; customers, contractors, and builders alike have found great value and convenience from this showroom and service. With a full-time designer on staff, along with tried-and-true product lines specially curated to suit the market, customers are sure to find just what they are looking for. Additionally, sound vendor relationships have been fostered and earned creating additional value to a potential buyer. Operating out of a showroom in a desirable West Michigan city a buyer can continue to lease the space at a fair market rate.Weighted gross revenues over the past several years have averaged $960,000 resulting in an average annual SDE (SDE = seller’s discretionary earnings, the normalized, weighted, historical cash flow of the business available to pay an owner-operator and service debt) of $177,000 over the same period.The business is being offered for $499,000. The listing price is based on a competitive SDE multiple of 3.0x (3.0 x $177,000 = $531,000). Included in the sale at an incredible value are on-hand materials, equipment with a fair market value in excess of $12,000, transition training, and the goodwill of a business which boasts a 20-year history of successful operations. Additionally, a meaningful sellers note may be available to qualified buyers.The seller envisions a cash free – debt free asset sale in which the seller retains cash and A/R while retiring all liabilities

details: Sign Up

This family-run legacy manufacturing Company began by developing a proprietary thin wall molding technique known as “DRY molding.” Since its first “smooth-surface” product, operations have used the technique for numerous other storage, protection, and shipping products. Today, the Company is known and respected for its production of precision-molded foam products and custom-designed molds.Customer applications include precision floats, insulators, structural parts, wafers, fiber coil management, and more. Sixty years of servicing this macro environment and providing these specialty items have created a reputation in the industry for innovation and quality.The many molds are included with the sale. Some are for exterior boxes which will enable ongoing opportunities for a Buyer thanks to the ability to make thousands more custom projects for minimal cost.While others in the industry (more commodity-oriented products) sell for 2-3 material costs, this operation easily sells at 10 x material costs.Its efficient, compliant facility and group of dedicated employees make this a turn-key opportunity to keep a legacy operation going.The Seller has a 15-point transition plan to ensure the success of a transaction.Detailed InformationFacilities: The custom-fitted space, that meets all air quality standards, is 27,000 square feet of manufacturing and office space. The current lease extends through 2026. Rent is $9,400 per month.Competition: The molded foam industry has three distinct segments. This operation falls under shape molding which produces custom packaging and components.Most direct competitors use large steam chests, resulting in products with vent marks across the surface.The difference in cleanroom manufacturing is the quality and the production of a truly smooth surface finish. This company’s reputation is built on its premier ability to mold small, thin parts, and caters to those who demand such quality, like medical applications.Those that produce rough surfaced parts are not competitors.Growth & Expansion: The Seller has a detailed outline of steps to increase sales and expand the previously dormant marketing plan by seeking new medical and component applications.He also foresees opportunities for high-density foams as replacements for thermoforms, fabricated urethane, and injection molded parts.An aggressive marketing plan would include reinstating trade show participation. Initiating SEO would also bring in additional prospects when orders increase, adding a third production shift would increase capacity.Financing: TBD if the deal structure and terms are acceptable.Support & Training: The Seller wishes to facilitate a successful and smooth transfer of the Business and will offer assistance and support as needed.Reason for Selling: It is time to retire.

details: Sign Up

Our client is offering a unique and versatile anti-shoplifting technology for sale to the market.  It is unlike any system currently in use.  This technology is discrete, effective and very economical to use and install.  The product is electronic merchandise or article-surveillance technology consisting of a detection device and a tag attached to the merchandise to be secured.  The tech is patented intellectual property.  The patents, trademarks and all intellectual property rights are included in the sale.The detection device can be a mat, placed close to a store’s exit doors, or a wall-hung “poster” which can be hung above an exit door, in restrooms, fitting rooms, employee entrances, emergency exits, elevators, escalators and other interior store spaces. Both types of detection device are unobtrusive and hardly noticeable.The items to be protected are secured by attaching a device or tag such as a bottle tag.  When the tagged item comes into proximity with the mat detection device or poster style detection device, an alarm sounds.  The tags can be used on numerous kinds of merchandise, such as electronics, laptop computers, clothing, liquor bottles and more.The tag’s alarm sound can be heard as a subject with a tagged item approaches the detection device (exit mat or wall hung poster) 10 feet ahead of the device, and even outside the store, where turbo tags are audible 600 feet into the parking lotThe devices have been installed and tested at major retailers worldwide, in the US, India, Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, and Europe.This is a totally hidden system. Simply plug it in - no tuning required.The system has higher detection rate than antennas and is far less costly than other Electronic Article Surveillance (EAS) devices.The technology owner and patent holder is semi-retired and wishes to sell the technology, which is ready to go, to a buyer with the means to continue the upward trajectory of the business.Our client owns all processes, and websites which they will transfer in full to a buyer.NDA is required to secure the first round comprehensive Confidential Information Memorandum (CIM) crafted by broker.Detailed InformationFacilities: N/AFinancing: Seller will consider financing if the price and deal structure is right.Support & Training: As needed – specific terms for transition support can be negotiated.
